about.summary: Performs (simultaneous) inferences for ratios of linear combinations of coefficients in the general linear model. Multiple comparisons and simultaneous confidence interval estimations can be performed for ratios of treatment means in the normal one-way layout with homogeneous and heterogeneous treatment variances, according to Dilba et al. (2007) <https://cran.r-project.org/doc/Rnews/Rnews_2007-1.pdf> and Hasler and Hothorn (2008) <doi:10.1002/bimj.200710466>. Confidence interval estimations for ratios of linear combinations of linear model parameters like in (multiple) slope ratio and parallel line assays can be carried out. Moreover, it is possible to calculate the sample sizes required in comparisons with a control based on relative margins. For the simple two-sample problem, functions for a t-test for ratio-formatted hypotheses and the corresponding confidence interval are provided assuming homogeneous or heterogeneous group variances.

name: r-mratios
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '1.4.0' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-mratios
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  fn: mratios_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/mratios_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/mratios/mratios_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: f8374a74ac1ed2c0b8f474052daad48134fb228f1f3f3ebde777fa3f3ae64c5e

build:
  noarch: generic
  merge_build_host: True  # [win]
  number: 1002
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-mvtnorm
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-mvtnorm

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('mratios')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('mratios')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=mratios
  license: GPL-2
  summary: Performs (simultaneous) inferences for ratios of linear combinations of coefficients
    in the general linear model. Multiple comparisons and simultaneous confidence interval
    estimations can be performed for ratios of treatment means in the normal one-way
    layout with homogeneous and heterogeneous treatment variances, according to Dilba
    et al. (2007) <https://cran.r-project.org/doc/Rnews/Rnews_2007-1.pdf> and Hasler
    and Hothorn (2008) <doi:10.1002/bimj.200710466>. Confidence interval estimations
    for ratios of linear combinations of linear model parameters like in (multiple)
    slope ratio and parallel line assays can be carried out. Moreover, it is possible
    to calculate the sample sizes required in comparisons with a control based on relative
    margins. For the simple two-sample problem, functions for a t-test for ratio-formatted
    hypotheses and the corresponding confidence interval are provided assuming homogeneous
    or heterogeneous group variances.
  license_family: GPL2
  license_file: '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - johanneskoester
    - bgruening
    - daler
    - jdblischak
    - cbrueffer
smithy_version:
No azure token. Create a token and
put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
3.7.0
